fields.summary: Issue navigator tabs

fields.description:
On the Dashboard, under the Assigned to Me Portlet, the way the sorting is, it shows all of the Trival issues first.  I would think we would want to see the more important issues, being it only shows 10 issues.

What would be even nice is if we could configure how we wanted to sort that portlet as well as how many issues to display in that portlet.  I use 1600x1200 screen resolution and can handle more than 10 issues.
fields.summary: Assigned to Me Portlet Sorting

fields.description: The automated backup service does an export, but does not compress the file, while the extension is ZIP, the content is still XML.
fields.summary: Backup service does not compress files, while the extension is ZIP

fields.description: The automated backup service does an export, but does not compress the file, while the extension is ZIP, the content is still XML.
fields.summary: Backup service does not compress files, while the extension is ZIP

fields.description:
It just happened once!
Here is the stack trace:

Exception occurred: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: 
Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.issue.IssueUpdate@6774ee, 
result: null: while inserting: [GenericEntity:ChangeItem][newvalue,null][oldstring,In create sales/purchase order bring the "select method dialog" up everytime that the department edit box has lost focus, ( not only when a new department coed is entered )][newstring,In create sales/purchase order bring the "select method dialog" up everytime that the department edit box has lost focus, ( not only when a new department code is entered )][group,15041][field,summary][oldvalue,null][id,17689] 
(SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO changeitem (ID, groupid, FIELDTYPE, FIELD, OLDVALUE, OLDSTRING, NEWVALUE, NEWSTRING) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
fields.summary: Exception while trying to update an issue!

fields.description: User must be able to switch DB bla bla bla !
fields.summary: User must be able to switch DB

fields.description: Give the administrator the ability to edit the filter used for "Open Issues" on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Administrator ability to edit "Open Issues: " on Dashboard

fields.description: When an issue is reopened, the issue does not appear in the "Open Issues: Assigned To Me" area.
fields.summary: Reopened issues not displayed in "issues assigned to me"

fields.description: It would be nice to log-in to JIRA via mobile devices, with a simpler wap interface.
fields.summary: Wap interface

fields.description:
I succesfully managed to crate issues from anonymous emails, but the sender's email adress does not appear anywhere in the created issue.
We need this field to contact him back!
fields.summary: Missing sender info from issues created from anonymous emails

fields.description:
Maybe I've misunderstood the use of the "Fix for Version(s)" field, but I understand it to be where you identify in which version of the code a particular issue will be addressed.

i.e. the Affected Version(s) field would record in what version(s) the issue was found, then when a solution had been found, then the version(s) that provided that solution would be recorded in the "Fix for Version" field.

If this is the case maybe "Fixed in Version(s)" would seem a more appropriate label perhaps.
fields.summary: Wording of the "fix for version" field label

fields.description: (this is a pedantic one) but the permission of "Project Adminstrators" doesn't contain a verb as the other permissions do - ideally it should be "Administer Project" or something similar.
fields.summary: Terminology of the "Project Administrators" permission

fields.description:
We ought to write up a brief page on the website, describing our policy wrt. user data, and then link to it from the new "send support email" page.


--Jeff
fields.summary: User data privacy statement

fields.description: We need to synchronize the OFBiz field type definition files from OfBiz CVS with JIRA before releasing.
fields.summary: Upgrade OFBiz field type definitions

fields.description:
When I use JIRA together with LDAP for external authentication I miss the option to not send a newly created user an email (which is default today).

The reason for this is that the LDAP users should use their LDAP password and not the one that the JIRA administrator setup (which is also in the email).
fields.summary: Option to skip sending newly created user email

fields.description:
On the personal road map, JIRA shows how many unresolved issues are in each version.  However, it shows the number of unresolved issues for the FIRST version shown for ALL versions.

Example:
Version 1.0   (6 of 10 issues are unresolved)  -- correct
Version 2.0   (6 of 4 issues are unresolved) -- really should be 2 of 4
Version Later (6 of 15 issues are unresolved) -- really should be 0 of 15

It is reusing the 6 for every version
fields.summary: Personal Roadmap - wrong values for number of unresolved issues

fields.description:
I have setup a filter top display issues that are overdue and the filter results include issues without a due date. 

I think it would be more logical to exclude issues with no due date if you have due date criteria in your filter. Issues without a due date are not really overdue.
fields.summary: Finding issues by due date include issue with blank due date

fields.description:
Ability to filter on time tracking related fields (Original estimate, Time Spent and Estimated time remaining).

It would be possible to specify a range.
Examples
From : 1
To : 10

From : Empty
To : 10
would mean les than or equal to 10

From : 3
To : 10
would mean between 3 and 10
fields.summary: Ability to filter on time tracking related fields

fields.description:
Resolving an issue should put the estimated time remaining to 0.

To be consistent, on the user interface that allows reopening an issue you should be able to enter a value for Estimated time remaining.

This is very annoying. Is there something I missed or do not understand?
fields.summary: Resolving an issue should automatically put the estimated time remaining to 0

fields.description:
The ability to control custom fields visibility could be very interesting especially for tools integrating with other systems. For example our internal MS Project integration addon could more easily (more elegantly) attach extra data to projects and issues to provide more powerful integration features.

The visibility options would be :
- Editable (current)
- Viewable (field can be viewed in the web interface but is populated by other means such as an MS Project integration addon)
- Hidden (Invisible to the end user)

The visibility is equally applicable to issue custom fields and project custom fields (See JRA-1991).
fields.summary: Read-only custom fields
Custom fields for Projects

fields.description:
When a user enters work done he would the specify the date the work was actually done. The default value would be the current date.

For already existing work log entries in the database, the day created would be put in the new field.

This would enable easier and much nicer integration with time sheet system. Work logged in Jira would serve as a starting point for users producing a timesheet in an external system.
fields.summary: Work log - date of actual work

fields.description: JIRA does not authenticate against SMTP servers. If the SMTP server requires authentication JIRA cannot use that server as it refuses to relay messages.
fields.summary: SMTP Authentication broken
Adding a comment does not change update date

fields.description:
Currently, the look & feel settings allow for specifying a logo for the top of each page.  It would be a nice touch if a favicon could also specified for each page; they're not only used by IE bookmarks these days, Galeon and Mozilla's Phoenix/Firebird browsers also display them in the address bar for every page.

All it needs is a field to enter the URL, as with the logo.  This should then be included in the <head> of each page, as
<link rel="shortcut icon" href="...URL FIELD CONTENTS..."/>
<link rel="icon" href="...URL FIELD CONTENTS..."/>
(both are needed to cater to the largest no. of browsers).
fields.summary: Add L&F support for a favicon

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1986].
  {panel}

file this under the "per project customizations" header.

The new notification scheme stuff is very sweet.  Allows just about limitless flexibility when customizing who gets sent notifications.

But, you can't customize *what* gets sent.  The same template gets used in all cases.

It's quite possible that for a given project (or set of projects) I want a completely different sort of email sent.  Maybe I have some boilerplate text that I want included only for those projects.  Or I want to limit the fields that get sent.

One way of doing this would be to extend the NotificationType interface to include a way of giving the template for a given event type.  So, in addition to having

 List getRecipients( ..)

you'd have something like

 String getTemplate(String action) { .... }

Then I could write my own notification scheme that did what I wanted.
fields.summary: select email template per project

fields.description:
Using the quick search to go directly to an issue using the key forces to enter the issue key all uppercase.

I think it should be case insensitive.
fields.summary: Quick search on issue key is case sensitive
Notification of project events

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to set-up a filter that returned issues that, for example, were "older than 1 month" so irrespective of what the current date is you could return issues based on relative as well as absolute criteria.
fields.summary: Enable filtering on "older than 1 month"

fields.description: Some of our users have expressed that they would like to be able to include some of our custom fields in the grid of issues returned by a filter in the issue navigator.
fields.summary: Option to configure the fields present in the issue navigator
Adding 1 or more permissions to multiple groups

fields.description:
I have a problem in JIRA 2.0.2 that I can't see if is fixed in a later
version (the Test Project on jira.atlassian.com does not send out emails,
and this is an email problem). So could anybody running a later version
please tell me if the problem described below still exist?

In JIRA 2.0.2 HTML emails display (among other things) three links used to
jump to either an issues "comments", "change history" or "workflow history":

View comments
http://jira.yourdomain.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=PRO-73
View change history
http://jira.yourdomain.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=PRO-73&page=history
View workflow history
http://jira.yourdomain.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=PRO-73&page=workflow

If either the change or the workflow link has been clicked on first the
comment link no longer works as expected. Because of JIRAs (normally nice)
cache behaviour the latest viewed page is shown if another one is not
explicit requested by the user.

To fix this problem the first link should instead be like this:
http://jira.yourdomain.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=PRO-73&page=comments
fields.summary: Incorrect urls in html mail

fields.description:
From a support request:

> We have problems with 'Find Issues':
> Using filter for:
>  - Project
>  - Assignee  (Specify Group)
> (nothing else!)
> 
> I tried to use a 'Group' filter for Assignee. Using a group which I have 
> not joined seems to be impossible.

I have verified that this bug exists on 2.0.2, and is fixed in 2.3, possibly earlier.

--Jeff
fields.summary: searching for 'assignee in group' fails when user not in specified group

fields.description:
In JIRA 2.3, changes to permission schemes do not take effect until the server is restarted.

As a test, log in as an administrator and deny everyone the 'Assign Issues' permission.  Then log in as a jira-developer and you'll find that the 'assign' link still exists.

--Jeff
fields.summary: Permission scheme changes do not take effect

fields.description:
A potential website bug, but we don't have a project set up for website bugtracking, so...

-------------------------------
From: Mike Cannon-Brookes <mike@atlassian.com>
Subject: FW: Evaluation registration doesn't work
To: Atlassian Development Team <dev @ atlassian.com>
 
Just a thought - perhaps this is the same Opera problem we have in JIRA, but
on the website?
 
Can someone test if you can signup / download on Opera 7?
 
Thanks,
M
-------------------------------
fields.summary: Evaluation registration doesn't work with Opera

fields.description:
That is in DESC order. 

Searching for all the issues for a project should return the latest issues first by default.
fields.summary: Sort by Issue Key should produce the latest issue first
Add Version of JIRA to the Admin System Info Page
"Updated by" search filter

fields.description:
Currently it isn't possible to add statuses. This would be ideal as we have a point in our workflow where a developer has addressed a bug and has passed it to a tester to test - i.e. a status of "Awaiting test". From here the tester would want to either resolve the issue as "Fixed" to re-assign it to the developer if it fails the test.

This in my opinion is more elegant than adding a resolution of "Awaiting Test" as it isn't possible to further change that resolution without re-opening the issue first - i.e an extra couple of steps. Also "Awaiting Test" has more a part of the active workflow, than a resolution as far as I can see.
fields.summary: Would like the facility to add new statuses
Can't change resolutions without re-opening an issue

fields.description: We have 1600 issues in the database. When we just use a issue number, it will revert to deach in description/summary. If we use the wrong case for the project-part, it will revert to description/summary.
fields.summary: Quick seach case sencitive in project name

fields.description:
If you upgrade from 2.0.2 to 2.3 you have to restart the server before you can access any permissions.

Permissions are cached in 2.3 but are not refreshed in the Upgrade task from 2.0.2 to 2.1.  So that 2.3 caches the permissions before they have been created and does not refresh them.
fields.summary: No Permissions after upgrade

fields.description: We changed our JIRA policy that only the team leaders are eligible to close issues. The former policy was that everyone was able to resolve & close an issue. However JIRA seems to ignore tne new permission scheme I applied, thus still allowing everyone to close an issue without "Close Issue" permission.
fields.summary: Close issue permission bug

fields.description:
Currently, we have one set of documentation released per version, and each JIRA release has the version encoded in its help URLs. Whenever a documentation bug is discovered, we patch CVS and update the latest docs.  However, old docs are still incorrect.

We should:
 - Branch jira-docs at each release
 - Apply universal doc changes to each branch, as well as the CVS head
 - Write a cron job that rebuilds each release's docs periodically.

--Jeff
fields.summary: Old documentation does not get updated

fields.description: We've just noticeed that when you mention a url in the summary of an issue, such as "problem with www.foo.com", when looking at the issue history window, you see errant javascript in the window, most likely due to Jira translating the www.foo.bar into a clickable url.
fields.summary: History popup doesn't like URLs in issue summaries

fields.description: With the changes in 2.3, the QuickSearch entry field is now case sensitive, we used to be able to just type in "bos-22" to jump to the issue, but now we have to type "BOS-22", minor issue, but it got me a complaint from our QA guy.
fields.summary: Quick Search entry is case sensitive

fields.description:
In the first column of Excel issue lists and timetracking reports, the URL is missing a '/secure', causing these links to break.

--Jeff
fields.summary: Excel URLs missing '/secure'

fields.description:
In JIRA 2.3 (possibly versions after 2.1 -- need to confirm), mails do not get sent out if using a freshly created database, because the "days per week" and "hours per day" properties are null.  This causes exceptions every time JIRA tries to send a mail:

java.lang.NumberFormatException: null
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:394)
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:476)
        at com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem.getIssueContextParams(IssueMailQueueItem.java:151)

Mails will build up in the queue, and won't be flushed.

For running JIRA instances, a quick fix is to go to the Administration section, select 'Time Tracking', click 'Activate' and then (optionally) Deactivate.

The full fix is as follows:

For the binary distribution, edit

atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/professionalupgrades.xml, line 59, and change:

    <upgrade build="48">

to:

    <upgrade build="48" setup="true">

In the source distribution, the same file can be found in 
src/etc/upgrade/professionalupgrades.xml

Then restart JIRA, and the problem should be resolved.



--Jeff
fields.summary: JIRA emails not sent: java.lang.NumberFormatException: null

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 25/Nov/2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi Guys,

We are proud to announce that JIRA 4.3 has just been released!

4.3 includes the new LDAP integration functionalities that we've been working on.

In addition, we've completed a whole host of other cool new features. For more information - please check out our release notes at: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.3+Release+Notes.

Thanks for your patience, and feel free to contact us if you have feedback or questions for us.

Regards,
Edwin Wong
JIRA Product Management
edwin at atlassian dot com


{panel}

NOTE:  We have updated this description based upon our plans to improve the LDAP support in JIRA

Currently, JIRA's LDAP integration is limited to being able to check a user's password against that in a LDAP directory, as documented at

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/ldap.html

If you're not aware, Confluence and Bamboo use atlassian-user, FishEye and Crucible have their own stack, and JIRA uses OSUser. Crowd's LDAP stack is different again. 

We are going to put Crowd's LDAP stack into both JIRA and Confluence, and then into the rest of the products. This is a large amount of engineering, and in JIRA in particular, will affect a lot of the code. Much of the Crowd team will be helping out on this effort. The work will not be delivered in JIRA 4.0, but it will start as soon as 4.0 ships.  This issue has been assigned to the short term roadmap of JIRA to reflect this.
fields.summary: Improve the LDAP stack in JIRA

fields.description: summary says it all.
fields.summary: issues on Dashboard are in reverse order of priority

fields.description:
I would very much like to be able to add due dates to issues. Please inform me if this is already a possibility.

Kind regards,
Jon-Erik Troften
fields.summary: Possibility to set due dates for issues

fields.description:
We need the ability to log work to days past and the ability to change the date of a work log entry.

Often times, work is logged later once a user returns to the office.  Currently we have to go into the database and manually change the date the work occurred.

This ability would save a huge amount of time!
fields.summary: Allow date selection for work log

fields.description: Line 29: contstantsManager
fields.summary: Misspelling in template/standard/issuetable_subset.jsp

fields.description:
When searching on a custom field of type 'date', we get the calendar javascript popup.  but not when we're entering the issue... Instead we only get a text field with the text underneath reading: "The date should be in the format dd-mm-yyyy, eg. 17-11-1979."
 
How about that same date picker for the entry screen?

-- Mike Curwen
fields.summary: Date Picker on Custom Fields (when entering issues)

fields.description:
On the "View Profile" page, the "Edit Profile" link at the bottom left is 1) indented with a non-breaking space and 2) not in its own table cell.  Looks a bit odd.

-- Adam Harvey
fields.summary: Edit Profile link on View Profile page is indented

fields.description:
A suggestion from Serge Knystautas:

  "I might suggest renaming "All" on the filter tab to "Manage".  Maybe
  just me, but I never thought to look for it there, and was expecting
  something like the "Saved Filters" panel in the dashboard."
   -- <3EE6760F.4070106@lokitech.com>

Another reason for this change is that 'All' is directly under the 'Find issues' tab, which might lead users to the assumption that clicking 'All' would "Find All issues".  Content-seeking users have been trained to ignore the left menu (containing the vital 'Filter:' text).

--Jeff
fields.summary: Change 'All' to 'Manage' in filter tab

fields.description:
simplified chinese can not been displayed correctly

-- guoxiaonan
fields.summary: simplified chinese can not been displayed correctly

fields.description:
When linking an issue to another, there is currently a [select issue] link, which launches an issue picker popup. It would be nice to make this an icon.

--Jeff
fields.summary: Icon for 'find issue' when linking issues

fields.description:
Just so I don't forget: on the 'add new notification' page, we ought to use javascript to select the applicable radio button when the user clicks on the associated text box. Same as with due date picker.

--Jeff
fields.summary: Add javascript to auto-select type of notification

fields.description:
Ant's <zip> command does not preserve the executable bit.  This means that in JIRA's *.zip releases, the user has to first 'chmod +x bin/*.sh' before anything will work.  We should provide tar.gz distributions to avoid this.  Perhaps an alternative is to use a hacked Maven with Ant 1.6..

--Jeff
fields.summary: Need tar.gz releases

fields.description:
The JIRA standalone releases contain Tomcat's README.txt and RELEASE-NOTES-4.1.txt files, which I imagine is rather confusing for users at first.

--Jeff
fields.summary: JIRA standalone has misleading README and RELEASE-NOTES files

fields.description:
When looking at my personal roadmap (URL like: http://myserver/secure/BrowsePersonalProject.jspa?id=10010&report=roadmap&subset=3)

It always list:  (0 of XX issues are unresolved)  The zero never changes.  I couldn't find an open issue on this.

Also, I tried Refreshing Statistics on the project, but to no avail.

-- Landon Clark
fields.summary: Personal Roadmap summaries wrong

.

-- Frank Baxter
fields.summary: Choosing the select issue option when linking causes a 500 error

fields.description:
When trying to 'release' a version in 2.2.1 (with patch) I get a 404 error saying the following:

HTTP Status 404 - No view for result [input] exists for action [EditVersionReleases]

The requested resource (No view for result [input] exists for action [EditVersionReleases]) is not available

-- Michael Brown
fields.summary: Get 404 when trying to release a version
Automated time tracking

fields.description:
Using the documentation & example found here:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=2665&messageID=48692907#48692907 

... and Hani's example, create documentation for how to use XML/XSL to create JIRA portlets.

-- Scott
fields.summary: Create docs for XML transformations

fields.description:
We need documentation that shows how to recover from deleting the admin user / admin permission.

-- Scott
fields.summary: Add documentation to help recover from lost passwords

fields.description:
The following datetimes come up on an issue work flow

Damien O'Rourke   [ Start: Today 10:34 AM  End: Today 04:38 AM ]    

the finish datetime is correct ... the start datetime should be 'yesterday' or yesterday's date

-- Damien O'Rourke
fields.summary: Incorrect datetime

fields.description:
In the issue navigator, searching for 'foo' will match entries, but 'foo*' won't.  This is a bug in Lucene 1.2, fixed in 1.3 rc1.  We should probably upgrade Lucene for the next release.

--Jeff
fields.summary: Search terms ending with * don't match anything

fields.description:
When doing a copy of special characters into Jira, such as quotation marks and/or apostrophes, on update, they are being replaced with strange characters. For example: Create a "Switch Template" Feature --> Create â¿¿Switch Templatesâ¿ Feature

-- Aaron Godert
fields.summary: Single and double quotes pasted in are being converted to garbage characters
JIRA configuration options should also be editable on a project level

fields.description:
When clicking on a issue-link in a email notification, the user is asked to login first (if not already logged in ofcause). After login the user is returned to the dashboard. It would be nice if JIRA remembered where the user wanted to go and then forward him/her there instead.

Today the user has to remember and write the issue ID into the "VIEW ISSUE #:" field.

This should ofcause also apply not only to deep links to issues, but to all links in general.

-- Thomas Watson
fields.summary: Remember desination after loggin in

fields.description:
A user has pointed out that our test project on jira.atlassian.com is fairly useless as a demonstration of JIRA, as it only allows issues to be created and commented on.

Now that we have per-project permission schemes, is there any reason we couldn't allow users to do anything to an issue?

Assign Issue
Resolve Issue
Start Progress
Delete this issue
Edit this issue


--Jeff
fields.summary: Allow all bug operations in jira.atlassian.com test project

fields.description:
When sorting filter results by the Resolution field, they don't always come up as expected. I thought this was perhaps a 2.1 Pro issue, but I can get a similar result here on atlassian's 2.2.1 Pro.

Use Case:
- Bring up all issues reported by user "harvea"
- Sort by resolution

You'll see there's a closed issue, marked as "Cannot Reproduce" that shows up in the middle of a bunch of "UNRESOLVED" issues.

-- Adam Harvey
fields.summary: Sort by resolution not always correct

fields.description:
we get odd looking bugs sometimes as proper quotes get corrupted in an issue name or description. eg. what starts out as:

Change the word ‘state’ to ‘county’.

[the inverted commas are proper ones]
becomes

Change the word â€˜stateâ€™ to â€˜countyâ€™. 

this happens because the text is copied out of Word which has its smartypants apostrophes turning regular typewriter quotes into typographically correct ones.

-- Jed Wesley-Smith
fields.summary: Character conversion errors

fields.description:
Old Orion and oc4j containers only support the draft version of the spec.

We need for all our filters to support setFilterConfig() instead of init.

-- Scott
fields.summary: Filters do not support draft version of the spec

fields.description:
If typing information in Microsoft Word (using Quotes for example), and then copying and pasting that into a work log or comment block or any text field within Jira.  Those Quotes are displayed incorrectly.  I've done this in other applications and the text gets stored correctly so I don't know what is going on inside of JIRA that is causing it.

Might have to Parse the text to clean it up for known characters.

-- Adam W. Saxton
fields.summary: Special Character Text is displayed incorrectly

fields.description:
After defining a subscription for an issuefilter, the content of the Email I receive has an unresolved identifier:

-------------Copy&Paste-------------
Issue Subscription 
Filter: SBB Assigned To aanneck (3 issues)
All SBB Issues assigned to aanneck
Subscriber: aanneck

${SRUtils.getDescription($param, $user)}
Project: Service Back Bone
Assignee: aanneck
-------------Copy&Paste-------------

-- Andre Anneck
fields.summary: Subscription Email-Report contains unresolved variable/method: ${SRUtils.getDescription($param,$user)}

fields.description:
I found the issues XDT-217 and XDT-405, but can't download its attachments.
The target address is: http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/attachment/10134/borland.zip
The response is: HTTP 404 Not Found

Not only this attachment is unreachable.

-- R. Lemos
fields.summary: Broken link (404 - Not found)

fields.description:
Deleting the only issue in a project does not properly set the counts correctly on the open issues page for the project. I see -1 for unscheduled and nocomponent.

-- Joel Lucsy
fields.summary: Deleting the only issue in a project

fields.description:
why doesn't jira 2.2.0 support simplified chinese display? And we are going to buy it if it supports.

-- guoxiaonan
fields.summary: why doesn't jira 2.2.0 support simplified chinese display?

fields.description:
>From Mike Brown (via jira-user):

I've noticed a warning in the logs for Jira 2.2.1

WARN [velocity] org.apache.velocity.runtime.exception.ReferenceException:
reference : template =
 templates/email/html/filtersubscription.vm [line 22,column 17] :
${SRUtils.getDescription($param, $user)} is not a valid reference.

-- Scott
fields.summary: SRUtils not passed correctly to mail templates

fields.description:
If I create a saved filter, give it a name, but leave the description blank, then the text subscription email contains an unresolved Velocity expression:

Issue Subscription
Filter: Custom filter (3 issues)
Subscriber: jeff

${HTMLUtils.stripTags($SRUtils.getDescription($param, $user))}
Project: Test Project
...


--Jeff
fields.summary: Text subscription emails have unexpanded velocity statements

fields.description:
I don't know if it's related to the recent server problems and restoration from backup, but I just noticed that the links for the attachments on a number of the XDoclet issues are giving "404 Not Found" errors when I try to view or download them.  For example, XDT-16 http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=XDT-16  XDT-471 http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=XDT-471 and XDT-478 http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/xdoclet/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=XDT-478

-- Andrew Stevens
fields.summary: Attachment links giving 404s

fields.description:
If you have given group "Anyone" Assignable user permission, the list of assignable users only contains "Unassigned"

-- Steven Warren
fields.summary: Assignable user doesn't list users if group anyone is attached

fields.summary: Can't install 2.2.1 with Orion/Oracle - insert issue
Ability to make Jira 'read only'

fields.description:
We have the following TimeTrackingAdmin settings:

Time Tracking
Time tracking is currently ON.
The number of working hours per day is 8.
The number of working days per week is 5.

After logging some work we see the following "Work Logged" entry in ViewIssue:
Time Worked: 2 weeks (this is correct, as entered by the developer)

Content of Notification Email:
Time Logged: 3 days, 8 hours


Now there are two issues with this email:
- 3 days + 8 hours != 2 weeks
- if 1 day == 8 hours, then why doesn't the email say "4 days"


The issue in question has been created with version 2.0.2. I haven't tested with issues that were created with 2.2.1 yet.

-- Lars K?hne
fields.summary: Time Worked not reported corretly in Notification email

fields.description:
Users can't search for partial word matches, if a job contains "fatalerror" and we search on "fatal", its not found.

I think this is more a flaw in lucene thou.

-- Mark Derricutt
fields.summary: Search for partial word

fields.description:
>From the dashboard I clicked on the 'All' filter for a project which took me to the filter page as expected. 

On that page I was unable to access the other 'standard' filters (e.g. 'Outstanding', 'Assigned to me'), so I was forced to go back to the dashboard in order to be able to do so.

In version 1.4 the filter page seems to have all the functionality that v2.0 has, but additionally it provides access to the same standard filters that are present on the dashboard.

Has the decision been taken to remove this functionality? If so its a shame as the default filters are of use the majority of the time, and they can be quickly accessed from the filters page in v1.4.

-- Nick Davidson
fields.summary: Lack of access to 'default' filters from the filter page

fields.description:
See for prelude JRA-1919

When adding a binary file (MSWord 2000) it gives an 
 'Invalid Form Data, no boundery encountered'
error. When looking at the file, all the extended ASCII characters are different.

IE 5.00.3502.1000 128-bits / Win2000 sp3

Note that using the same browser on another machine, where the standalone is used instead of the WAR, it gives the same error, but the attachments are valid!

Note: Using Opera 7.11 the error does not show, but the attachment is still invalid.

Screenshots of part of the uploaded file on client & server are available.

-- Michael van Leeuwen
fields.summary: Binary attachments fail

fields.summary: Warnings & Errors while upgrading

fields.description: It would be excellent if one could attach a file(s) when an issue is being created. In this way is saves having to go through additional steps to attach files that you initially intended to attach when creating the issue.
fields.summary: Attaching files during issue creation
Control Concurrency for Update Functions in JIRA

fields.description:
If unpacked in the root directory ('unzip jira-2.2.1-professional.zip'),  the distribution will write itself all over the place. Users need to first create a containing directory, and unzip JIRA into that.  This is Wrong; all well-behaved packages ought to create their own containing directory, and so should JIRA.  For example, all Jakarta software does this, as has GNU software for yonks.

--Jeff
fields.summary: JIRA zips have no containing root directory.

fields.description:
(Re-added after the hdd failure..)

According to the doco, it should be possible to a ddd a due date to existing issues.

I've enabled issue scheduling (by setting up the permissions), but can't seem to set the due date with the "edit issue" feature.

When creating new issues, however, i can specify the due date.
fields.summary: Cannot add due date to existing issues

fields.description:
We have created a small project to evaluate JIRA, and clicking "Start Progress" under "Available Workflow Actions" while viewing the issue results in this message:

-- begin message --
HTTP Status 404 - No view for result [error] exists for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]

type Status report

message No view for result [error] exists for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]

description The requested resource (No view for result [error] exists for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]) is not available.
Apache Tomcat/4.1.12
-- end message --

Have we missed a setup step?

-- Adam Preble
fields.summary: Clicking "Start Progress" results in Tomcat error

fields.description: -- Dan Howard
fields.summary: Alility to assign a task to more than 1 developer

fields.description:
Permission screenshots need updating. The 'add' column has reappeared, and a few other changes.

-- Jeff
fields.summary: Update screenshots in permissions docs
